alert.note: Alert for Brown; Eastern Cherry; Keya Paha; Rock (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 8:31AM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Cherry, northwestern Rock, northern Brown and Keya Paha Counties through 915 AM CDT... At 830 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Norden, or 20 miles east of Valentine, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Springview, Norden, Burton, Keller Park State Recreation Area, Thomas Creek State Wildlife Management Area, Bobcat State Wildlife Management Area, Pine Glen State Wildlife Refuge, Antelope Peak, Meadville, North River Trail and Sparks. This includes the following highways... Highway 183 between mile markers 197 and 225. Highway 20 between mile markers 223 and 226. Highway 12 between mile markers 15 and 66. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Brown; Eastern Cherry; Keya Paha; Rock
